item.title: No ICE in Minnesota bundle launches on itch.io
item.content:encoded:
Game developers and other creators on itch.io have just launched the No ICE in Minnesota bundle on the platform. The collection of video games, tabletop games, books, zines, game assets (and more) goes for $10, and at time of writing includes 1,439 items. 

Included in the collection are well-known indies like Draknek and Friends' A Good Snowman is Hard to Build, Necrosoft's Hyper Gunsport, and Hempuli's Baba is You, alongside creative tools like alienmelon's Electric Zine Maker and over a thousand physical games.

"We created this bundle to raise funds for Immigrant Law Center of Minnesota in response to the Trump administration sending ICE agents to the Minneapolis area and the reckless murder of an innocent people by ICE agents," reads the bundle description.

"ILCM provides free immigration legal representation to low-income immigrants and refugees in Minnesota and North Dakota. They also work to educate the community about immigration matters and advocates for public policies which respect the universal human rights of immigrants. ILCM provides services based on capacity and has a generally high demand for services. The more we are able to fundraise, the more people they will be able to assist."

Related:Riot Games lays off roughly 80 employees from 2XKO team

Hosted by tabletop creator Jes the Human, the bundle is on offer for one month. All proceeds minus fees will be sent along to ILCM.

About the Author

Editor-in-Chief, GameDeveloper.com

Danielle is the editor-in-chief of Game Developer, with previous editorial posts at Fanbyte, VICE, and Polygon. Sheâ€™s also a lecturer in game design at the Berklee College of Music, and a hobbyist game developer in her spare time.
